page.title: 05GLENLIVET VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The Glenlivet village hall is run by a committee made up of the representitives of the clubs who use the hall and members of the local community with the doctor, minister and headmaster as trustees. Money is raised for the upkeep of the hall in the summer by prize bingo sessions. Adjoining the hall is a {football} {pitch}and{caravan site. The football pitch is used by a local team from Tomintoul and Glenlivet and they play throughout Moray in the Amateur League. The caravan site is open to members of the Caravan Club of Great Britain. It is a small site and usually no more than five caravans are allowed at any one time.
